file_content.text: Leave now, and I won't put a bounty on your miserable head.
Stand down, you fools! The intruder is no threat. I knew the Empire wouldn't hold its tongue for long.
What can I say? The Republic made me an offer first. They get armies that can survive on Quesh, I get to make adrenals after they win.
But business is business, especially if the Empire has a better chance. What is your offer?
Give me that HK, and I won't burn this place to the ground.
Cooperate or die.
I see. Your offer doesn't leave much room for negotiation.
I'm not interested in your business. I came for the HK.
Give me what I want.
What you ask is impossible. The HK is my personal bodyguard.
Think long and hard about your allies. While you're thinking, I'll take that HK.
Reconsider your deal.
Hah! You came unprepared, my poor friend. Even you couldn't take this HK by force.
I'm not so sure we should do business, especially after you killed half my guards. Maybe I should have HK blast you instead.
I'd like to see him try.
Let him.
Goodbye, cruel world.
I guess I deserve it.
Always wondered who'd have better reflexes.
Fine with me.
I'm prepared to die.
Go ahead.
Er... perhaps I spoke too quickly. My attachment to the droid is mostly sentimental.
That droid couldn't bring down flimsiplast and you know it.
That's impossible.
Lies! You wouldn't have come this far for a broken droid. It would be useless to you... wouldn't it?
Maybe I should gut you right here.
I don't like threats.
I admit HK is a costly indulgence. I'm willing to sell him, if you have the credits.
Your life for the droid.
How about I don't kill you?
You drive a hard bargain, scum. You're lucky I'm in a generous mood.
The droid is yours. Take what you want and leave!
Or I could kill you and take your credits.
No deal. [Kill Koghaa]
No! Guards, attack! HK? Wake up, you blasted piece of scrap!
No need for things to get ugly. I can be very reasonable.
